pullrequest.title: Fix second-order dynamic library dependency (makes gazebo buildable with the GNU GoLD linker)

content.raw:
>Makes sense to me. I will assume that the additions of QT_LIBRARIES are in the same line.

Yeah, the QT stuff popped up when linking against gazebo from the plugins in `gazebo_ros_pkgs`.

>Jonathan Bohren I'm curious about what difference in compilation time have you get when using GoLD.

Not too much difference with Gazebo, but it saves a TON of time when I'm building Orocos stuff.

For Gazebo on my i7 laptop, `make -j4` gives:

* **gold:** `3935.56s user 191.35s system 380% cpu 18:05.45 total`
* **ld:** `4045.88s user 202.89s system 381% cpu 18:33.67 total`
content.html:
Makes sense to me. I will assume that the additions of QT_LIBRARIES are in the same line.

Yeah, the QT stuff popped up when linking against gazebo from the plugins in gazebo_ros_pkgs.

Jonathan Bohren I'm curious about what difference in compilation time have you get when using GoLD.

Not too much difference with Gazebo, but it saves a TON of time when I'm building Orocos stuff.

For Gazebo on my i7 laptop, make -j4 gives:

  • gold: 3935.56s user 191.35s system 380% cpu 18:05.45 total
  • ld: 4045.88s user 202.89s system 381% cpu 18:33.67 total
